request_pathways.name: Authorization for Use or Disclosure of PHI (HMC1072)

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (unrelated organization — Hillcrest Internal Medicine, San Diego, CA)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: System-wide generic HIPAA authorization form with 'at the request of the patient' as one purpose option among several, supplemented by Swellbox online portal and MyChart.

red_flags: Blanket liability waiver bundled into authorization — patients must release facility from liability as condition of authorizing disclosure
No submission instructions on form — no mailing address, fax number, or delivery method specified
Sensitive information consent (mental health, HIV, substance abuse) bundled with no opt-out
bright_spots: Multiple request pathways available: MyChart portal, Swellbox online wizard, and paper form
System-wide form clearly identifies all covered facilities via checkboxes
Centralized Medical Records Request page is easy to find and well-organized

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — the system-wide Medical Records Request page is reachable in 2-3 clicks from hillcrest.com, though direct Claremore-specific searches don't surface it.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the org offers Swellbox online portal and MyChart for electronic submission, but the downloadable paper form has zero fillable fields despite being digitally created.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but has notable problems — logical layout and clear facility selection, but dense legalistic 'I understand' section, no 'all records' option, run-on sentences in sensitive-information paragraph, and vestigial carbon-copy duplicate pages.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — generic third-party authorization form lists patient access as one purpose among many, with no reference to Right of Access or § 164.524, though portal alternatives exist.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements beyond what the law requires — blanket liability waiver bundled into authorization, vague fee disclosure with no schedule, bundled sensitive-information consent with no opt-out, though anti-conditioning and revocation language are present.

overall.summary: Hillcrest Hospital Claremore benefits from its parent system's multi-channel infrastructure (portal, MyChart, paper form) and easy findability, but the paper form is a non-fillable generic authorization with legalistic language, a liability waiver, and no patient access differentiation.
